intro: Ardisia ferruginea var. macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaved beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, including countries such as Thailand, Vietnam, and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green elliptical leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. Following flowering, it produces bright purple to red berries that are a striking feature of the plant. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive foliage and showy fruit.
